pullRequest.title: moved ocfl index into db
pullRequest.bodyText:
JIRA Ticket: https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3309 & https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3292
What does this Pull Request do?
Moves the index that maps Fedora IDs to OCFL ids into the database. Additionally, the rebuild logic was adjusted so that both the containment index and the ocfl index are rebuilt when they are out of sync with the OCFL repository.
How should this be tested?

Startup a DB and Fedora using the following instructions.
Add some resources
Inspect the index in the db
Stop Fedora and restart it again using a different db configuration
Inspect the index in the new db and see that the index is populated

MariaDB
Start the DB:
docker run --name f6-mariadb -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=root-pw -e MYSQL_DATABASE=fcrepo -e MYSQL_USER=fcrepo-user -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=fcrepo-pw -p 3306:3306 -d mariadb:10.5.3

Access the CLI:
docker exec -it f6-mariadb mysql -ufcrepo-user -pfcrepo-pw -Dfcrepo

Start F6:
mvn -Dfcrepo.db.url=jdbc:mariadb://localhost:3306/fcrepo -Dfcrepo.db.user=fcrepo-user -Dfcrepo.db.password=fcrepo-pw clean jetty:run

Stop DB & cleanup:
docker stop f6-mariadb
docker rm f6-mariadb

MySQL
Start the DB:
docker run --name f6-mysql -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=root-pw -e MYSQL_DATABASE=fcrepo -e MYSQL_USER=fcrepo-user -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=fcrepo-pw -p 3306:3306 -d mysql:8.0

Access the CLI:
docker exec -it f6-mysql mysql -ufcrepo-user -pfcrepo-pw -Dfcrepo

Start F6:
mvn -Dfcrepo.db.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/fcrepo -Dfcrepo.db.user=fcrepo-user -Dfcrepo.db.password=fcrepo-pw clean jetty:run

Stop DB & cleanup:
docker stop f6-mysql
docker rm f6-mysql

PostgreSQL
Start the DB:
docker run --name f6-postgres -e POSTGRES_USER=fcrepo-user -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=fcrepo-pw -e POSTGRES_DB=fcrepo -p 5432:5432 -d postgres:12.3

Access the CLI:
docker exec -it f6-postgres psql -U fcrepo-user -d fcrepo

Start F6:
mvn -Dfcrepo.db.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/fcrepo -Dfcrepo.db.user=fcrepo-user -Dfcrepo.db.password=fcrepo-pw clean jetty:run

Stop DB & cleanup:
docker stop f6-postgres
docker rm f6-postgres

Interested parties
